Description.val: Repair and Test Equipment Budget Line Item provides repair and test equipment consisting of more than 250 different items of equipment (separate TAMCNs) required to support the operation and maintenance of USMC ground based weapon systems or major end items.  Repair and test equipment includes items such as tool kits, shop sets, manual and automatic test equipment, as well as, metrology and calibration equipment.  The following acquisition programs fall under the repair and test equipment budget line: General Purpose Electronic Test Equipment (GPETE), General Purpose Mechanical Test Equipment (GPMTE), and General Purpose Tool, Sets & Kits (TS&K) which were renamed General Purpose Tools and Test Equipment in FY14, Third Echelon Test System (TETS) and Marine Corps Automatic Test Equipment Systems (MCATES) were renamed Automatic Test Systems in FY14, and Electronic Maintenance Support System (EMSS) for FY14 & FY15/MAGTF Logistics Support Systems (LSS) for FY16 and out, and other related repair and test equipment items.

Justification.val:
FY2014 Baseline Appropriation: $ 40.085M ($36.501M Active; $3.584M Reserves)

General Purpose Tools and Test Equipment (GPT&TE): $21.309M ($17.725M Active; $3.584M Reserve): This program is combination of previously separate funding for Tool Sets & Kits (TS&K), General Purpose Mechanical Test Equipment (GPMTE), and General Purpose Electronic Test Equipment (GPETE) which supported both active and reserve forces.   The General Purpose Tool and Test Equipment (GPT&TE) budget line represented a wide variety of Tool Kits, Shop Sets, Electronic Test Equipment, hand-held mechanical test equipment, and large mechanical test equipment contained in shelters or buildings.  All of these items are commercial off the shelf or modified commercial off the shelf type equipment that are necessary and required to support the field maintenance effort of USMC ground equipment & weapon systems. These are the tools & test equipment used by Marine maintenance personnel in a field or expeditionary environment.

Automatic Test Systems (ATS) $17.276M ($11.590M Active; $5.686M Reserves):  This is a combination of previously separate funding for Third Echelon Test Sets (TETS) and Marine Corps Automatic Test Equipment Systems (MCATES) funded in prior years.  Funding supported procurement of Automatic Test Systems (ATS) such as the Third Echelon Test System (TETS), Virtual Instrument Portable Equipment Repair/Tester (VIPER/T), the Ground Radio Maintenance Automatic Test Systems (GRMATS) and the applications needed to enable the ATS to test weapon system platforms. These systems provided mobile automatic testing on line replaceable units and circuit card assemblies, enabling rapid restoration of weapon systems.  Equipment consisted of hardware and software portable equipment.

Electronic Maintenance Support System (EMSS) $1.500M: Funding supported management, administration, and oversight efforts required to support the fielding of Block I refresh of the Electronic Maintenance Support System.

FY2015 Baseline Appropriation: $27.334M ($23.950M Active; $3.384M Reserves)

General Purpose Tools and Test Equipment (GPT&TE):$12.732M ($9.348M Active; $3.384M Reserve):  Funding supports both active and reserve forces for the procurement of GPT&TE.  The General Purpose Tool and Test Equipment (GPT&TE) Budget line represents a wide variety of Tool Kits, Shop Sets, Electronic Test Equipment, hand-held mechanical test equipment, and large mechanical test equipment contained in shelters or buildings.  All of these items are commercial off the shelf or modified commercial off the shelf type equipment that are necessary/required to support the field maintenance effort of USMC ground equipment & weapon systems. These are the tools & test equipment used by Marine maintenance personnel in a field or expeditionary environment. 

Automatic Test Systems (ATS) $13.806M ($11.327M Active, $3.459 Reserves):  :  Funding supports procurement of Automatic Test Systems (ATS) such as the Third Echelon Test System (TETS), Virtual Instrument Portable Equipment Repair/Tester (VIPER/T), and associated applications that enable ATS to test weapon system platforms. These ATS provide mobile automatic testing on line replaceable units and circuit card assemblies, enabling rapid restoration of weapon systems.  Equipment consists of hardware and software portable equipment.

Electronic Maintenance Support System (EMSS) $0.796M: Funding will be focused on procurement of Electronic Maintenance Support System (EMSS).  Procuring a Commercial Off-The-Shelf (COTS) hardware device equipped with network interfaces, Software Defined Test capabilities and regional servers.

FY2016 Baseline Appropriation Request: $21.210M ($20.001M Active; $1.209M Reserves)

General Purpose Tools and Test Equipment (GPT&TE):$4.366M ($3.157M Active; $1.209M Reserve):  Funding supports both active and reserve units for the procurement of GPT&TE.  The General Purpose Tool and Test Equipment (GPT&TE) Budget represents a wide variety of Tool Kits, Shop Sets, Electronic Test Equipment, hand-held mechanical test equipment, and large mechanical test equipment contained in shelters or buildings.  All of these items are commercial off the shelf or modified commercial off the shelf type equipment that are necessary/required to support the field maintenance effort of USMC ground equipment & weapon systems. These are the tools & test equipment used by Marine maintenance personnel in a field or expeditionary environment. The reduced funding from FY15 to FY16 supports the Marine Corps decision to align budgetary resources to other requirements.

Automatic Test Systems (ATS) $13.238M ($7.398M Active, $5.840M Reserves):  Funding supports procurement of Automatic Test Systems (ATS) such as the Third Echelon Test System (TETS), Virtual Instrument Portable Equipment Repair/Tester (VIPER/T), and associated applications that enable ATS to test weapon system platforms. These ATS provide mobile automatic testing on line replaceable units and circuit card assemblies, enabling rapid restoration of weapon systems.  Equipment consists of hardware and software portable equipment.

MAGTF Logistics Support Systems (MLS2) $3.606M:  Funding will be focused on procurement of Electronic Maintenance Support System (EMSS).  EMSS is a sub-element of MLS2.  FY16 will procure a Commercial Off-The-Shelf (COTS) hardware device equipped with network interfaces, Software Defined Test capabilities and regional servers. The increase in funding from FY15 to FY16 is due to the increased quantity buy of EMD hardware.

OCO: 
FY2014 Overseas Contingency Operations (OCO) : $16.081M

General Purpose Electronic Test Equipment (GPETE) $0.782M:  Funding was used to reset TAMCN A7081-Data Comm Test Sets and provided engineering/logistical support to rapidly field and maintain equipment in support of Operation Freedom Sentinel (OFS).

General Purpose Mechanical Test Equipment (GPMTE) $7.570M:  Funds focused on acquiring deployable Fuel System Test Shops used to field test, align, and repair vehicle components in Afghanistan/OFS Theater of Operations. Funding was also used to buy and field GPMTE items for use in OFS in order to replace items that were damaged, lost, or destroyed during operations. New GPMTE items were bought and fielded in order to support new vehicles, modified vehicles, or vehicle enhancements fielded to OFS.

General Purpose Tool, Sets, & Kits (TS&K) $5.005M:  Funding used to buy TS&K items for use in OFS in order to replace items that were damaged, lost, or destroyed during operations. New TS&K items were bought and fielded in order to support new technology weapon systems fielded to OFS.

Third Echelon Test system (TETS) $2.724M: Funding used to buy and field Automatic Test Systems to replace testers damaged or destroyed during overseas contingency operations in support of OFS.

FY2015 Overseas Contingency Operations (OCO): $.980M

Automatic Test Systems (ATS) $980K:  Funds will be focused on Virtual Instrument Portable Equipment Repair/Tester (VIPER/T) used to field test, align, and repair vehicle components in Afghanistan/OFS Theater of Operations. Funding will also be used to buy and field ATS items for use in OFS in order to replace items that are damaged, lost, or destroyed during operations.

FY2016 Overseas Contingency Operations (OCO) Request: N/A
